intro: Logania choretroides, commonly known as the white logania, is a striking flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stem and clusters of small, white, trumpet-shaped flowers. Its foliage consists of opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Logania choretroides is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in warm climates.
